title: Emergency Nuclear Fallout Shelter Construction
brief: How to rapidly construct shelter protection against nuclear fallout radiation.
steps: Step 1: Find shelter within 5 minutes - speed is absolutely essential for survival.
Step 2: Seek natural terrain like ditches, ravines, rocky outcroppings, hills, or river banks.
Step 3: If no natural shelter exists, dig a fighting position or slit trench immediately.
Step 4: Work from inside the trench as soon as it's large enough to cover part of your body.
Step 5: Stack dirt carefully and evenly around the trench for additional shielding.
Step 6: Dig deep enough for good protection, then enlarge for comfort later.
Step 7: Cover with 1 meter or more of earth for maximum protection.
warnings: Without shelter, the dosage in the first few hours exceeds that of an entire week later.
Do not build a roof unless materials are readily available - extended exposure is more dangerous.
Keep all body parts covered with clothing while building to prevent beta burns.
source: FM 21-76 US Army Survival Manual — U.S. Department of the Army (Chapter 23 - Survival in Man-Made Hazards)
